article.headline: Butler 70, Detroit 69
article.story: INDIANAPOLIS (AP) -- Duane Lightfoot hit two free throws with five seconds left in overtime to lift Butler to a 70-69 victory over Detroit on Saturday as the officials changed two late calls benefiting the Titans after looking at video replays. Butler's Mike Monserez had 24 points, including nine in overtime, and seven assists to give the Bulldogs their second-straight victory. His 3-pointer with 42 seconds left in overtime gave the Bulldogs (6-9, 2-4 Horizon) a 68-67 lead. Detroit (8-7, 2-3) then ran the shot clock down, and guard Jimmy Twyman shot another 3-pointer as time expired. The officials at first signaled the shot was good, but a video replay showed Twyman didn't get the shot off in time. Detroit fouled Lightfoot on the next possession, but he hit both free throws to give Butler a 70-67 advantage. Titans' guard James Theus then pushed the ball up the court and launched a shot from the top of the key as time expired. The officials signaled the shot a 3-pointer, but overturned the call after a replay showed Theus had stepped on the line. The Bulldogs battled back from a seven-point deficit in the final seven minutes of regulation and tied the game on a Bruce Horan's 3-pointer with 35 seconds left. Detroit, which led 30-29 at half, held for the last shot but missed to send the game into overtime. Lightfoot had 15 points and eight rebounds for Butler. Elijah Warren led Detroit with 20 points, while Ryvon Covile added 16.
